business.headline: Bengal to be impacted by Bangladesh import curbs, but nation first: OfficialsThe central government on Saturday imposed port restrictions on the import of a few Bangladeshi goods, such as readymade garments and processed food items.

India restricts Bangladesh imports through northeast check postsA wide range of Bangladeshi products will be restricted via the Integrated Check Posts in the northeastern states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

Defence stocks extend rally on possible budget boost. What should investors do?The NSE Nifty India Defence index surged over 5% intraday on Friday. Cochin Shipyard and GRSE have been leading the charge, with the latter gaining a stunning 30% since May 13.

Singtel offloads 1.2% stake in Bharti Airtel in $1.54 billion dealSingtel, which has been an investor in Airtel for over 20 years, said its stake would drop to 28.3%, valued at around S$48 billion, from 29.5% previously.

Blaming NRIs won't solve India's housing problem, says investor. Here's whyNRIs earn in strong currencies like US dollars, pounds, or euros. So when they convert that money to rupees, they can afford much more. A house that seems expensive to someone in India may feel quite reasonable to someone earning abroad.

Cochin Shipyard, GRSE rally up to 12%: Why are these defence stocks rising?Cochin Shipyard jumped 12.51% to Rs 2,039 on the BSE at around 11:47 am, extending its rally for a sixth straight session. GRSE climbed 11.10% intraday to Rs 2,510, taking its cumulative gains to over 30% since announcing results post-market on May 13.

Stop all bookings to America, warns ace investor as Indians ditch TurkeyTourism to Turkey and Azerbaijan has already taken a major hit, especially after reports that Pakistan used Turkish-made drones in its recent strikes.

Borana Weaves IPO to open May 20: Check GMP, expected listing gainsAccording to grey market trends, the IPO is commanding a premium of Rs 55 per share, suggesting potential listing gains of over 25% for successful applicants.

Apple assures India manufacturing plans intact despite Trump remarks: ReportWhile Apple has not issued a public statement, sources said the company reaffirmed to Indian officials that India remains a key part of its global supply chain.

Explained: Why Yes Bank shares are in focus todayYes Bank stock: The shares fell over 1% in early trade but later recovered to trade in the green. At the start of the day, Yes Bank shares opened at Rs 21.50, slightly below Thursday's close of Rs 21.51.

Pakistan offers zero-tariff bilateral trade deal to US: ReportThe development comes shortly after US President Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, following four days of intense cross-border hostilities involving drones and missile strikes.
Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares fell 3% in early trade today At 9:35 am, shares of Bharti Airtel were trading 2.69% lower at Rs 1,816.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndusInd bank shares down 2% after private lender flags interest mistakeIndusInd bank stock opened at Rs 735.95 after having closed at Rs 780.30 in the previous session. The shares have lost 7.29% in the past 5 days, 23.55% over the last 6 months, and 45.48% over the past year.
Sensex, Nifty open lower after yesterday's rally; IndusInd Bank down 3%The BSE Sensex was down 226.18 points to 82,304.56 at 9:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 67.80 points to trade at 24,994.30.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyBoth the Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels in the last seven months in the last session. So far this week, the Nifty has gained around 4.5% and the BSE Sensex about 4%.
Stocks to watch on May 16: Hyundai, Airtel, IndusInd Bank, BHEL, Bajaj AutoHyundai Motor, BHEL, Delhivery, Emami will announce their earnings for the January-March quarter on Friday.

IndusInd Bank flags Rs 674 crore error as 'incorrectly recorded interest'The bank said its Internal Audit Department (IAD) found that a total of Rs 674 crore was wrongly shown as interest over three quarters in FY 2024-25.
India offered zero-tariff trade deal: Donald TrumpUS President Donald Trump claimed that India has offered the United States a trade deal with "literally zero tariffs".

YES Bank shares jump 21% in 5 days. What investors need to knowSMBC, a part of the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), plans to buy the 20% stake from State Bank of India (SBI) and seven private banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Axis Bank, IDFC First Bank, Federal Bank, and Bandhan Bank.

Sensex ends 1,200 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Tata Motors surges 4%The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,200.18 points to end at 82,530.74, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 395.60 points to close at 25,062.10.

Donald Trump claims India has offered zero-tariff deal in trade talksSpeaking at a business forum in Qatar, Trump said, "India has offered us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariff." He didn't provide further details, and there was no immediate response from the Indian government.

Planning a personal loan? 7 hidden charges you must know aboutMany people only look at the interest rate when taking a personal loan. But there are several other costs that can add up. Knowing these charges helps you plan better, avoid surprises, and even negotiate some of them with the bank.

Sensex jumps 1,300 points: Why is stock market rising today?As of 2:38 p.m., the S&P BSE Sensex had gained 1,217.88 points to reach 82,548.44, and the NSE Nifty50 had climbed 410.57 points to 25,077.50.

FDs vs PPF: Which investment option should you choose and why?By investing in PPF, you can claim a tax exemption of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C in a financial year, under the old tax regime. Moreover, the interest you earn from a PPF account is also tax-free. FDs, however, do not offer any tax deduction unless it's a 5-year tax-saving FD.

Don't want you building in India, Trump tells Apple CEO Tim CookTrump's remarks came just days after India threatened to impose retaliatory tariffs on the US. This was in response to the US raising duties on Indian steel and aluminium exports.

Mutual funds load up on IT, cut FMCG and telecom stakes in April: ReportKotak Mahindra Bank attracted the highest MF investment in the financial sector, with Rs 1,586 crore. IDFC First Bank and HDFC Bank followed, drawing Rs 1,150 crore and Rs 1,026 crore.

Tata Motors shares rise 4% today. Here's whyThe rise in Tata Motors' share price comes even after the company reported a 51% fall in its consolidated net profit to Rs 8,470 crore for the quarter ending March 2025.

Travel sites see spike in Turkey, Azerbaijan cancellations over Pakistan supportBoycott calls grow as Turkey and Azerbaijan back Pakistan. Travel sites like MakeMyTrip and ixigo report major cancellations and suspended bookings to these destinations.

entertainment.headline: Nothing, just Ananya Panday recreating Main Tera Tota… with father ChunkyAnanya Panday and her father Chunky Pandey recreated the iconic song 'Main Tera Tota Tu Meri Maina' at a Saturday award function. Videos shared on Ananya's fan pages quickly won hearts online.

Tom Cruise shares glowing praise for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas' BallerinaHollywood star Tom Cruise was all praises for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas's film 'Ballerina'. He spoke about it during the London premiere of his film 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning'.

Paresh Rawal confirms Hera Pheri 3 exit, says 'had no creative difference'Bollywood actor Paresh Rawal has announced his exit from the eagerly-awaited film Hera Pheri 3, clarifying that it is not due to creative differences. He expressed his respect and faith in the director Priyadarshan.

Sonu Kakkar reunites with Neha-Tony for parents' anniversary after family riftAfter publicly acknowledging a rift with her family, singer Sonu Kakkar was seen celebrating her parents' anniversary. The pictures also featured her siblings, Neha and Tony Kakkar.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 1: Tom Cruise film opens strong at Rs 17.5 cr'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' has made a grand entry in India, releasing six days ahead of the global launch and receiving an enthusiastic response from Indian audiences. The film has become the highest-opening Hollywood film of 2025.

Gram Chikitsalaya: Amol Parashar's show is a healing touch, diagnosing deeper truth'Gram Chikitsalaya' is about a doctor trying to make a village more aware of the healthcare system that they need, but it is also about a deep understanding of the neglected rural population of the country. The series is headlined by Amol Parashar as Dr Prabhat Sinha.

Malti's adorable tea party with Priyanka Chopra's manager is the cutest thingPriyanka Chopra's daughter, Malti, hosted an adorable tea party for her mother's manager. Sweet moments from their intimate celebration were shared online on Sunday.

Guns N Roses: Ecstatic fans say 'even gods wanted this to happen' after Mumbai showGuns N' Roses rocked Mumbai on Saturday with an electrifying performance. Elated fans shared highlights from the unforgettable night on their respective X handles.

Singer Rahul Vaidya thanks Virat Kohli for unblocking him: You are pride of IndiaAfter previously calling Virat Kohli and his fans "jokers," singer Rahul Vaidya has now thanked the cricketer for unblocking him on Instagram. Sharing a screenshot of his post, Vaidya praised Kohli, calling him the pride of India.

Aishwarya-Abhishek groove to Kajra Re at wedding, daughter Aaradhya joinsVideos of Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan from a recent wedding are now going viral. The clips were shared by singer Rahul Vaidya, who performed at the event.

Babil Khan exits Sai Rajesh's film after backlash: Things didn't go as plannedActor Babil Khan has confirmed exiting director Sai Rajesh's upcoming movie. The duo shared respective posts on social media expressing admiration for each other.

Haqeeqat, a war film forged in India's steely defiance in defeatHaqeeqat (1964) vividly portrays the bravery and sacrifice of Indian soldiers during the 1962 Sino-Indian war. The film combines gripping war scenes, patriotic music, and emotional storytelling to honour the heroes of Rezang La.

Thug Life trailer review: Kamal Haasan, STR in a gangster tale more like Nayakan 2.0The trailer of Mani Ratnam's much-anticipated film 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan, offered a stylish peek into a familiar gangster world, but with the director's signature storytelling depth and visual grandeur. The film also stars Trisha Krishnan.

Vijay Deverakonda wants more films with Rashmika, says 'chemistry not a problem'Actor Vijay Deverakonda candidly spoke about his marriage plans, his on-screen chemistry with Rashmika Mandanna, and whether he's currently seeking a life partner. The duo has long been rumoured to be in a relationship.

Ravi Mohan's ex-mother-in-law breaks silence amid row: Still want him as our heroAarti's mother and producer Sujatha Vijayakumar has responded to serious allegations by actor Ravi Mohan, clarifying her financial dealings and appealing for family peace. She shared a two-page statement on Saturday.

Siddharth Nigam was unaware of YRF before Dhoom 3: Mumbai bula ke bech diya tohActor Siddharth Nigam shares his initial disbelief and fears when auditioning for Dhoom 3. He felt the casting call was fake and feared that he would be trafficked.

Cannes becoming fashion event more than film festival? Actor Rahul Bhat answersRahul Bhat shares his perspective on the Cannes Film Festival, emphasising it as a celebration of cinema rather than just fashion. He is attending Cannes for the third time this year.

Thug Life trailer: Kamal Haasan ready to fight death in Mani Ratnam actionerThe highly-anticipated trailer of Kamal Haasan and Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' is out. Also starring Trisha Krishnan and Silambarasan in pivotal roles, the trailer was launched at a grand event on May 17.

Murderbot review: Alexander Skarsgard elevates show with deadpan deliveryReleased-Fri May 16, 2025'Murderbot' follows a security cyborg that hacks itself and who'd rather watch telly than protect humans. Apple TV's sci-fi comedy presents Alexander Skarsgard as the reluctantly sentient SecUnit navigating freedom while hiding its autonomous status from suspicious scientists.

general news.headline: Top Lashkar terrorist behind 3 big attacks in India killed in PakistanLashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Saifullah Khalid, who planned attacks in Nagpur, Rampur, and Bangalore, was living under a false identity in Nepal before relocating to Pakistan's Sindh province, where he was killed.

UP man arrested on charges of spying for Pak, had crossed border to share infoArrested from Moradabad in Uttar Pradesh, Shehzad had repeatedly visited Pakistan, smuggled goods across the border, and allegedly passed classified Indian security information to ISI agents.

Question of respect: Chief Justice flags 'protocol lapse' during Maharashtra visitChief Justice BR Gavai, during his first visit to Maharashtra, said that senior state officials —including the Chief Secretary, DGP, and Mumbai Police Commissioner — were absent to receive him.

Jyoti Malhotra kept in touch with Pak agents, was being developed as asset: CopsA day after YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra 's arrest over allegedly spying for Pakistan, the police explained how Pakistan's intelligence operatives were using Indian social media influencers to 'push their narrative'.

Killer weapons battle-tested, India-Pak mini-war will shape future warsLethal weapons — ranging from missiles to fighter jets to drones, and air defence systems — from multiple countries that saw trials for years witnessed battle-testing in the India-Pakistan mini-war. Over half a dozen Indian and Chinese weapons were war-tested for the first time. As the world's arms manufacturers and strategic experts take note of the limited India-Pakistan war, here's why it will shape all wars to come.

1 Game, 3 Winners: Gujarat, Punjab, and Bengaluru qualify for IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans took RCB and PBKS into playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

How 'Haldi Ghati' exercise helped India mobilise military rapidly for Op SindoorThe 'Haldi Ghati' military exercise was key in integrating air defence and joint command systems, enabling swift and coordinated action across the Army, Navy and the Air Force during Operation Sindoor.

17 of family killed in building fire near Hyderabad's Charminar; 8 were childrenFire broke out near Gulzar House in the Hyderabad Old City, an area close to the historical monument Charminar, resulting in the deaths of 17 people, including eight children.

Bangladeshi actor who played Sheikh Hasina in Mujib biopic arrested in DhakaBangladeshi actor Nusraat Faria was arrested at the Dhaka airport on charges of attempted murder in a case related to the mass uprising against then-PM Sheikh Hasina. Faria played the role of Hasina in the 2023 film 'Mujib: The Making of a Nation'.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

BJP keeps winning elections because Opposition is 'nakaam': Asaduddin OwaisiResponding to allegations that AIMIM was the BJP's 'B-team', Asaduddin Owaisi said such attempts showed the opposition parties' hatred of his party and said they were a "failure" as they couldn't stop the BJP from winning elections.

IMF slaps 11 new conditions on Pak, flags India risk after Op Sindoor: ReportThe IMF has imposed 11 new conditions on Pakistan for its next bailout tranche, emphasising parliamentary approval of a Rs 17.6 trillion budget and energy sector reforms.
Watch: Car rams another, then crashes into shop, passengers casually step out The CCTV footage shows the severity of the collision and the narrow escape of bystanders.

Weapons of mass dissemination: The India-Pakistan cyber frontierOperation Sindoor and the adversary's response to it weren't solely military. A parallel digital war raged, with deepfakes, bots and troll farms as new ammo

Odisha YouTuber who accompanied 'spy' Jyoti Malhotra to Pak under scannerPolice found that Jyoti Malhotra, a YouTuber from Haryana who was arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistan, had visited Puri in September 2024 and came in contact with a woman in the coastal town, who is also a YouTuber.

'Can't she call friends in Pak?' YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra's father defends herYouTuber Jyoti Malhotra was allegedly in touch with Pakistani intelligence officials via WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat, after she visited the neighbouring country.

Polish woman records man following her during trek in Himachal. Video goes viralKasia, a Polish content creator known for documenting her travel experiences online, was walking down a mountain from her guest house when the man approached her, asking for a picture.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Gaurav Gogoi was invited by ISI, visited Pak for training: Himanta SarmaContinuing his tirade against Gaurav Gogoi over his alleged "Pakistan links", Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma claimed the Congress MP was invited by the ISI to Pakistan and he received training there.

RR vs PBKS: Punjab edge closer to playoffs after defending 219 in Jaipur thrillerPunjab Kings edged closer to the IPL 2025 playoffs with a 10-run win over Rajasthan Royals in Jaipur on Sunday, May 18. Nehal Wadhera's 70 and Harpreet Brar's three-wicket haul helped PBKS secure an important win.

As another Gujarat family dies at US border, why 'America at all costs' still luresDespite warnings and crackdowns, the cycle of hope and heartbreak continues, with far too many having paid the ultimate price

Ashoka University professor arrested over social media post on Operation SindoorAli Khan Mahmudabad, a Political Science professor at Ashoka University, was arrested in Delhi over a social media post on Operation Sindoor, following a complaint by BJP youth wing.
Sailors dangle high above water after Mexican Navy ship hits Brooklyn Bridge A Mexican Navy training ship, the Cuauhtémoc, collided with the Brooklyn Bridge in New York around 8:26 pm.

Copycat Pakistan can't stop tearing into India's strategic cheat sheetIn the high-stakes game of strategy, Islamabad seems more focused on imitation than innovation. From diplomatic expulsions to global outreach and battlefield optics, Pakistan's every move has mirrored India's almost like reading from a borrowed script.

sports.headline: Captain Shubman Gill delighted to evolve as Gujarat Titans storm into playoffsShubman Gill said that he's delighted to evolve from his learning curve as captain, as Gujarat Titans qualified for the playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), following a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Carlos Alcaraz spoils Sinner's Rome party, asserts Roland Garros favourite statusItalian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz reaffirmed his status as the favourite to defend his French Open crown by hammering World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in straight sets in the final in Rome on Sunday. The defeat ended Sinner's unbeaten run in the 2025 season.

Shreyas Iyer becomes 1st captain to lead 3 different teams to IPL playoffsPunjab Kings have qualified for the IPL 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2014. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different franchises into the IPL playoffs, marking a unique achievement.

Sai Sudharsan 108 trumps KL Rahul's 112 as GT storm into playoffsGujarat Titans secured a spot in the IPL 2025 playoffs after a commanding 10-wicket win against Delhi Capitals. Their strategic batting and top performances from Sudharsan and Shubman Gill highlighted the team's strong title ambitions this season.

DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav risks sanction after snapping at umpire over LBW callIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav lost his cool after his LBW appeal against Sai Sudharsan was overturned. Gujarat Titans dominated the Capitals in a high-stakes match on Sunday.

1 Game, 3 Winners: Gujarat, Punjab, and Bengaluru qualify for IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans took RCB and PBKS into playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Arshdeep borrows Mohammad Rizwan's iconic 'win, learn' line after expensive spellPunjab Kings' seamer Arshdeep Singh recalled Pakistan's Mohammed Rizwan's iconic line following his expensive spell against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in IPL 2025.

Daring Max Verstappen beats McLarens to win Imola Grand PrixMax Verstappen secured a commanding victory at the Imola Grand Prix with a daring first lap overtake on Oscar Piastri. His win intensifies the Formula 1 title battle against the McLaren drivers.

Will take any opportunity with both hands: LSG's William O' RourkeWilliam O' Rourke is excited for any opportunity that may come his way in the remaining three matches of the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

KL Rahul hits 5th IPL hundred, goes past Shubman Gill in all-time listIPL 2025, DC vs GT: KL Rahul hit a 60-ball hundred for Delhi Capitals in their must-win game at home against Gujarat Titans. It was Rahul's fifth IPL hundred and his first since the 2022 season.

Harpreet Brar wins Player of Match award weeks after marriage, dedicates it to wifeIPL 2025, RR vs PBKS: Harpreet Brar dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife, weeks after their marriage. The left-arm spinner took three wickets in Punjab's successful defence of 219 runs in Jaipur.

Arshdeep borrows Mohammad Rizwan's iconic 'win, learn' line after expensive spellPunjab Kings' seamer Arshdeep Singh recalled Pakistan's Mohammed Rizwan's iconic line following his expensive spell against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in IPL 2025.

KL Rahul hits 5th IPL hundred, goes past Shubman Gill in all-time listIPL 2025, DC vs GT: KL Rahul hit a 60-ball hundred for Delhi Capitals in their must-win game at home against Gujarat Titans. It was Rahul's fifth IPL hundred and his first since the 2022 season.

Harpreet Brar wins Player of Match award weeks after marriage, dedicates it to wifeIPL 2025, RR vs PBKS: Harpreet Brar dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife, weeks after their marriage. The left-arm spinner took three wickets in Punjab's successful defence of 219 runs in Jaipur.

Injury scare for Shreyas Iyer? Punjab Kings captain gives updatePunjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer missed the second innings of their match vs Rajasthan Royals due to a finger injury sustained in practice. Iyer said that he did not know the nature of the injury and needed to get it checked.

KL Rahul reaches 8000 T20 runs faster than Virat Kohli but slower than Babar AzamIPL 2025: KL Rahul became the fastest Indian to score 8,000 runs in Twenty20 cricket, breaking Virat Kohli's record. The Delhi Capitals star is also the third-fastest overall to reach the milestone.

RR's chasing woes: Captain Samson unable to pin it down to a couple of reasonsSanju Samson said that he was unable to pin down RR's chasing woes to a couple of reasons after they lost to PBKS in Jaipur on Sunday, May 18. Rajasthan have just 6 points from 13 matches in IPL 2025.

DC vs GT: Kagiso Rabada makes comeback, Mustafizur Rahman replaces Starc in DelhiKagiso Rabada makes his comeback in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) after serving one month suspension for recreational drug use. On the other hand, Mustafizur Rahman is also set to play his first game of the season for Delhi Capitals.

Beautiful Barcelona deserved to win LaLiga: Real Madrid coach Carlo AncelottiCarlo Ancelotti praised Barcelona's beautiful football as they won the LaLiga title and domestic treble. He acknowledged injuries impacted Real Madrid's season and promised to prepare for his next challenge with Brazil.

RR vs PBKS: Punjab edge closer to playoffs after defending 219 in Jaipur thrillerPunjab Kings edged closer to the IPL 2025 playoffs with a 10-run win over Rajasthan Royals in Jaipur on Sunday, May 18. Nehal Wadhera's 70 and Harpreet Brar's three-wicket haul helped PBKS secure an important win.

RCB announce refund for washed out game vs KKR: Complete guide to get reimbursementRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have announced a ticket refund for their washed-out match against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. Here's a complete guide to get the reimbursement.

Travis Head down with Covid-19, SRH star's return: Coach VettoriTravis Head will miss SRH's upcoming IPL match against Lucknow due to a Covid-19-related delay. There is no clarity on when and here he contracted the virus.

Beautiful Barcelona deserved to win LaLiga: Real Madrid coach Carlo AncelottiCarlo Ancelotti praised Barcelona's beautiful football as they won the LaLiga title and domestic treble. He acknowledged injuries impacted Real Madrid's season and promised to prepare for his next challenge with Brazil.

RCB announce refund for washed out game vs KKR: Complete guide to get reimbursementRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have announced a ticket refund for their washed-out match against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. Here's a complete guide to get the reimbursement.

Travis Head down with Covid-19, SRH star's return: Coach VettoriTravis Head will miss SRH's upcoming IPL match against Lucknow due to a Covid-19-related delay. There is no clarity on when and here he contracted the virus.

Crisis man Nehal Wadhera reveals secret to PBKS' big-hitting successIPL 2025, RR vs PBKS: Nehal Wadhera rescued Punjab Kings from early setbacks, smashing 70 off just 37 balls. Punjab posted 219 in 20 overs, the highest total in the history of IPL by a team that lost its first three wickets for less than 35 runs.

RR vs PBKS: Shreyas Iyer subbed out as Shashank Singh fills in as captainIn an interesting move, Punjab Kings decided to sub out captain Shreyas Iyer ahead of the second innings of the match against Rajasthan Royals. Shreyas was apparently under the weather after batting.

MS Dhoni has real fan base, rest all have paid fans on social media: Harbhajan SinghFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that MS Dhoni has the real fan base in Indian cricket history while other players have paid fans social media.

Liverpool, Arsenal target Benjamin Sesko set to for RB Leipzig exit: ReportsBenjamin Sesko's departure from RB Leipzig now seems inevitable, with Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea circling. The Slovenian forward's release clause is considered affordable, making him a top target in the summer transfer window.

Sarfaraz Khan loses 10 kg through strict diet to prepare for England tourIndia batter Sarfaraz Khan is toiling hard to prepare for the upcoming England tour, having lost 10 kg through a strict diet plan. Sarfaraz is yet to play a single Test outside of India.

Ahead of India series, ECB sacks data analysts as McCullum to rely on gutAhead of the upcoming India Test series, the ECB has decided to part ways with their data analysts as coach Brendon McCullum will trust his gut feeling and intuition going forward.

Sanju Samson sacrifices RR opening spot for Vaibhav Suryavanshi vs PBKSSanju Samson made a selfless return to RR's XI, backing teenage prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi to open despite recent struggles. The skipper's decision highlights his recognition of the youngster breakout performance this season.

Lot to improve: Gauff strives for progress after losing Italian Open finalItalian Open 2025: Coco Gauff said that she needs to work on her game before the French Open after losing back-to-back finals on clay in Madrid and Rome.

RR vs PBKS: Punjab hand big-hitting Mitchell Owen debut, Royals bring in MaphakaPunjab Kings have handed Mitchell Owen his IPL debut while Rajasthan Royals have replaced Jofra Archer with the young Kwena Maphaka. Owen is considered to be one of the most exciting T20 talents in Australia.

GT's Ishant Sharma looks past playoffs in DC clash: Every game importantGT pacer Ishant Sharma urged focus beyond just the DC clash, highlighting the importance of maintaining momentum across all remaining league games to clinch a top-two finish, which provides a second chance to reach the IPL final.

Don't want Jasprit Bumrah to be made India Test captain: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri revealed why he doesn't want Jasprit Bumrah as the next India Test captain. Bumrah has been considered by many to be the favourite to replace Rohit Sharma as the new captain of the Indian Test team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
